events.name: Designing Conversational Experiences for Google Assistant

venue.name: City Centre Library - Room 402 - 10350 University Dr, Surrey

events.description:
Build Actions for Your Community

We are happy to launch the official "Google Developer Group" chapter in Surrey with our first event

"Designing Conversational Experiences for Google Assistant"

This is an event for developers of all skill levels to come together to learn how to create Actions for Google Assistant.

Event schedule:
16:45 - Registration
17:00 - [Talk] Designing Conversational experience
17:45 - Snacks Break
18:00 - [Code Lab] Build Actions for the Google Assistant
19:00 - Wrap up

events.name: DevFest 18 - Learn how to build cross platform apps, AR apps and ML powered apps

venue.name: City Centre Library - Room 402 - 10350 University Dr, Surrey

events.description:
Google Developer Group Surrey is hosting its first DevFest.

It's a 5-hour event with lunch and snacks being served.

2 PM - Registration
2:15 - 3:00 pm - Build ML powered apps using Firebase ML Kit
3:00 - 3:30 pm - Firebase ML kit sample code lab
3:30 pm - Lunch break and networking
4:00 - 4:45 pm - Cross-platform apps using Flutter
4:45 - 5:30 pm - Flutter code lab
5:30 - 6 pm - Snacks break
6:00 - 7 pm - AR app using ARCore and Google Poly - Session by Shubhra Sarker

Speaker Info
Shubra Sarker is an HCI researcher at School of Interactive Arts and Technology. He specializes in AR and VR development. He has worked on multiple AR projects in the domain of interactive learning. He also likes to solve challenging problems regarding software and game programming. He has been developing 2D and 3D games for 4 years now and is specialized in Unity and C# programming. Find out more about him at - https://ca.linkedin.com/in/shubhrasarker22

Fantastic opportunity to learn about new technologies and expand your knowledge.

Please share the word around. Hope to see you there.

GDG Surrey follows a strict code of conduct and anti-harassment policy. Please read the community guidelines here -
https://support.google.com/developergroups/answer/3340512?hl=en&ref_topic=3340510
events.how_to_find_us: 3rd Floor of Central City library, (Library is very near to Surrey Central skytrain station)

events.name: Android Dev Summit Viewing Party in Cineplex Theater

venue.name: Cineplex Cinemas Marine Gateway and VIP

events.description:
First things first. This exclusive event requires a registration on the event website

You MUST RSVP in the following site to attend this premiere event.
https://events.withgoogle.com/android-dev-summit-viewing-parties/
_________________________________________________________________________________

We invite you to the special & unique viewing parties ever!

Android Dev Summit is happening on November 7-8, 2018 in Computer History Museum. We wanted to make this special event more accessible and create a great experience for you.

Join the experience in a movie theater to watch livestream summit at the viewing party

We reserved your spot for the Android Dev Summit viewing parties in many cities and movie theaters. While you're watching the sessions live, you'll meet other developers and learn about the new Android updates. There will be food and a great atmosphere. Come and join the party.

events.name: Google Developer Group SOCIAL - Tech Mentoring, Side Projects and Career advice
events.description:
Google Developer group presents SOCIAL - An evening all about Mentoring, Hustle in Product development and Side Projects. We invite all developers, designers and product managers to GDG Surrey's first event of the year.

We are kicking things off with a more casual informal style gathering. The idea is to hang out and discuss "Your Ideas", "Your projects" and "Your mentoring needs" over some hot coffee and snacks.

The objective of this small meetup is to help you with

1. Finding mentors
2. Resume and Portfolio reviews
3. Interview guidance
4. Side Project collaborations
5. Product ideation

Come join us on Thursday, from 6 pm to 8 pm, Feb 7th, 2019 and start the year STRONG!!

events.name: Surrey's Machine Learning Workshop with TensorFlow.js- Tensorflow DevSummit 2019
events.description:
Google developer group Surrey and SurreyCodes Foundation bring to you TensorFlow Dev Summit Viewing Party 2019.

The TensorFlow Dev Summit viewing party brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from the city for a technical workshop on Tensorflow.js, We will all also talk about tensorflow success stories and conduct a codelab on TensorFlow.js with the community.
Agenda

6:00 - Meet and greet
6:30 to 7:30 - Tensorflow.js Workshop
7:30 - Q&A and networking

GDG Surrey is also sponsoring snacks and drinks for the event. So come enjoy, learn and put those learnings to action at this community first event.

We would also like to extend our thanks to our Venue Sponsor - Beta Collective. Beta Collective is a casual, inviting coworking space located in the heart of Downtown Surrey. They provide flexible desk, office, and room rentals in a spacious 4,000sf workspace designed to accommodate a variety of startups, entrepreneurs, and non-profits.

events.name: International Women's Day (IWD) 2019 Celebration:  Developers and Personal brand
events.description:
Please note, to attend the event you must register here - https://bit.ly/2SE62FO

Women Techmakers Surrey is proud to announce its mega launch event. We are celebrating the 2019 International Women's Day by sharing some remarkable stories of our growing community of designers, developers and technology entrepreneurs. The fantastic #IamRemarkable family as we like to call it.

This event is open to both men and women who have career experiences and learnings that they want to share. We look forward to an evening of meaningful conversations and connections.

Now, about our rockstar speakers of the evening.

Samantha Ming is a Front End Developer who switched her career from business to programming. Her success has led her to become a Google Developer Expert and a writer for DailyJS. She will be talking to us about how developers, especially women developers, can grow their personal brand. She will also share her experiences of moving from a business background into technology and how she became invincible by embracing failure.

Ainsley Robertson is the Manager for Developer Experience at Clio. She will be discussing with us steps that companies can take to get more women into tech leadership roles. She will also walk us through things women can do before and after getting the jobs to gauge the inclusivity of any work environment. She will also share the initiatives Clio is taking to build its highly diverse and competent technology team.

Sounds intriguing? Please don't forget to register here: https://bit.ly/2SE62FO

The dayâ€™s agenda:
6:00 PM - Introductions
6:10 PM - Session on "Personal branding for developers" by Samantha ming
7:00 PM - Networking & Food & Drinks
7:15 PM - Session on " How to get more women into tech leadership" by Ainsley Robertson
7.45 PM - Raffle draw and Prizes
7.55 PM - Group Photograph
8:00 PM - Event Ends

The Open discussion is just Q/A session where attendees can ask their queries to the speaker

Also, guess what? Food and Drinks are on the house!!!

We also have some fantastic swags for all attendees and a special gift for the raffle draw winner.

We also have some fantastic swags for all attendees and special gift for the raffle draw winners.

What is #IamRemarkable?
The #IamRemarkable initiatives thrive to empower women and underrepresented groups speak openly about their accomplishments in the workplace and beyond, thereby breaking modesty norms and glass ceiling.

Our Objective as WTM Surrey:
Improve self-promotion motivation and skills, Change social perceptions towards self-promotion and Foster diversity

A note about our venue Sponsor: CodeCore (https://codecore.ca/)
CodeCore is the leading Bootcamp in Vancouver teaching cutting-edge web technologies. They have graduated 400+ students over the last 5 years, many of them are leaders in the Vancouver Tech scene. They have built an amazing community of developers that is very supportive and welcoming and they hope you will become a part of it soon.

Date - Tuesday, April 2, 2019, from 6 pm to 8 pm
Venue - CodeCore, 142 W Hastings St, Vancouver, BC V6B 1G8

We are also looking for volunteers and members - Interested in joining? Send your details here - https://bit.ly/2SE62FO

#IWD19 #WomenTechmakers #WTM

group_profile.intro: Hi! I am Supratim. Currently practicing HCI research at School of Interactive Arts and Technology.  Please feel free to contact me for any inquiry. My Twitter handle : www.twitter.com/borax12

organizers.name: Procheta N.
organizers.bio: I am doing M.Sc at SFU with a passion for AI and Machine learning. I have hands-on experience in data mining, Web and Game design. Currently, working on real-time 3D AI virtual human with facial emotion and movement recognition, Unity3D & 3D modeling
